content.description:
Stand start on a big jug a few feet right of the start of

Pink Squiggles

.  Climb the slab.  Don't fall in the river!

Sit start on 3 foot long slopey rail located at the center of the boulder.  Reach left hand up to jug.  From there, continue right using two positive holds.  Aim for the jug at about 9 feet.  Finish as of

Pink Squiggles

.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spot.

content.description: Sit start on the 3 foot long slopey rail located at the center of the boulder.  Climb straight up and veer slightly left utilizing jugs, sidepulls and crimps.

climbs.name: Seeing Eye Bitch aka Seeing Scrapes

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the 3 foot slopey rail located at the center of the boulder.  Get your left foot pasted way out left and pull left hand up to a sidepull undercling (you may need to utilize some intermediates to reach it).  Go up the face using two opposing gastons.  Reach up to better holds and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter. Harness and quickdraw to cross the tyrolean.
content.location: Left most route on the boulder.

content.description:
Start matched on the right side of the 3 foot long slopey rail located at the center of the boulder.  Cross left hand to a poor sloper located up and left of the "Speedbump" sloper feature (the jugs on warmup 2 are off).  Use some funky beta to reach the micro slopey crimp out right (located 8 inches from the

Pink Squiggles

arete). Bump your right hand to the slopey arete. Hold the swing! Finish as of

Pink Squiggles

.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.  Harness and quickdraw to cross the tyrolean.

content.description:
Recession Proof starts just right and down of the 3 foot slopey rail located at the center of the boulder. Sit-start with your left hand on a small slopey crimper and your right hand on a small undercling / side-pull. Slap left hand up to the "Speedbump" sloper feature. Make a big throw out right to a sloper. Finish as of

Pink Squiggles

. The only reason this problem doesn't get 4 stars is because the start isn't obvious. Awesome moves!
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.  A quickdraw and harness is helpful to cross the tyrolean.

content.description:
Start on obvious chalked jug on right side of boulder.  Climb the arete via compression sloper moves. Get to the jug at about 9 feet and top it out.

Variation 1: Zion Express (V6)- Start as of Pink Squiggles and climb only the arete avoiding the compression slopers out left.  FA Todd Findley.

Variation 2: Assquatch (V8) Start with your right hand on the sloper just down and left of the start jug on Pink Squiggles and your left hand on a undercling rail just right of the "Speedbump" slopey feature.  Pull off the ground and make a slap with your right hand up to the arete of Pink Squiggles.  Finish as of Pink Squiggles.  The name came about when I fell into the river when I slipped off the first move. FA Joe Varela.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.

content.description:
Start on "

Recession Proof

", traverse left and climb into "seeing eye bitch" V7 linking it to the top. bad crimps and crosses make the crux. Beta video coming soon...on Vimeo, I'll post the link here.

Start on the jug of "

Pink Squiggles

," and traverse left on the holds of "

Recession Proof

". Make your way to the start of "

Seeing Eye B****" aka "Seeing Scrapes"

and to the topout by only using the contrived holds. It is an unfortunate but necessary contrivance that the end has to be so contrived, but it climbs so well. Not going straight up through the jugs keeps the difficulty consistent.

Start on the left hand crimp and right hand undercling/sidepull as for '

Recession Proof

', climb up and into '

Return to Squiggles

'.  Was a bit more taxing for me than

Recession

.
content.protection: The landing is fairly flat, and the block is fairly small but lends itself to explosive back flaps down to the rocks.  A few pads would do it.  More, and you don't need to spot.  You can just watch and laugh, the way it should be.

content.description:
Climb

Recession Proof

, but exit up and right manteling on some slopers.

Sit start to

Waterside

, left hand small crimp, right hand slot and right foot heel toe cam to start.
